title: Revolved Side Angle
description: Balancing, Standing, Twists Primary body parts engaged Calves, Chest, Hamstrings, Shoulders, Spine Ankles, Knees, Middle Back / Lats, Obliques, Quadriceps Stretches and strengthens legs, opens chest Rejuvenates abdominal organs Reduces fatigue, increases energy How to perform Revolved Side Angle Begin in Crescent with your right leg forward. Twist your torso to the right with an exhale. Snuggle your left armpit outside of your right knee and place your left fingertips on the floor. Reach your right arm to the sky with an inhale. Lower it alongside your right ear with an exhale. Gaze toward the sky.
alignment_cues: Maintain steady breath throughout the pose
Keep proper alignment based on pose type
Listen to your body and modify as needed
